intro: Cascarilla acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved cascarilla, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, elliptical leaves with acute tips. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cascarilla acutifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
